module.simplesync.control

Class SimpleSyncModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • module.iface.AbstractProsumer
      • module.simplesync.control.SimpleSyncModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataElementEventListener, Module, Prosumer

    public class SimpleSyncModule
extends AbstractProsumer
implements DataElementEventListener
    Module implementing a simple (well actually not so simple anymore) prosumer that tries to synchronize two file systems at connected provider in a smart way.
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Method Detail

      • checkAndLockPath

        private int checkAndLockPath(ProsumerPort port,
                             java.lang.String[] path)
        Checks and locks path. We only do one action on a given path at a time. Other actions are postponed.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result, 0 = OK, 1 = not OK

        public void enterShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Enters shutdown. Prepare to stop, finish running operations. Return within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_MANAGEMENT.

        IMPORTANT: You must still accept incoming calls but try not to make new ones to other modules yourself. Don't (un)register stream listeners here!

        Specified by:
        enterShutdown in interface Module

        IMPORTANT: You may already accept incoming calls but try not to make any yourself yet. Don't (un)register stream listeners here!

      • getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Gets supported control interface commands. Called from authorized control interfaces to receive supported control interface commands. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Specified by:
        getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands in interface Module
        Returns:
        the supported control interface commands (not null)

      • getSupportedModuleCommands

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedModuleCommands(Port port,
                                                                  java.lang.String[] path)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Gets supported module commands for given path. Called from authorized connected modules to receive supported module commands. Propagate to other connected modules and merge result if possible/appropriate. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Specified by:
        getSupportedModuleCommands in interface Module
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path (may be null, for example to send more general commands)
        Returns:
        the supported module commands (not null)

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Checks if module is ready. This does not mean that the module can actually answer calls from other modules. It only means that there is no severe problem that would stop the hole system from working properly. Return within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_MANAGEMENT.
        Specified by:
        isReady in interface Module
        Returns:
        true, if module is ready

                                                                        java.lang.String[] path,
                                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        Description copied from interface: Module

        command - the command
        path - the path (may be null)

        the answer/result (not null)

      • streamCopy

        private void streamCopy(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.io.OutputStream out)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        BrokerException,
                        ModuleException,
                        AuthorizationException
        Copies two streams.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read from
        out - the output stream to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception has occurred
        BrokerException - if streams get interrupted by broker
        ModuleException - on another error
        AuthorizationException - if module is not authorized to read/write data

      • sync

        private int sync(SyncJob job)
        The location where the core synchronization is done. Here we decide what to do for each synchronization job based on data inside the job and updated data from connected modules.

        TODO: Wow, 675 lines of code, no doubt, this IS a monster. Even with commends it is hard to maintain. Cut it down, introduce stable intermediate states.

        Parameters:
        job - the job
        Returns:
        the result, 0 = OK, 1 = retry later (wait an more and more increasing interval), 2 = postpone for a few seconds, -1 = invalid/outdated

      • unlock

        private int unlock(ProsumerPort port,
                   java.lang.String[] path)
        Unlocks a locked path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result, 0 = OK, 1 = not OK
